intro: Grewia banahaensis, commonly known as the Banah Hills bush, is a small shrub native to the highlands of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are often eaten by birds and other wildlife. Grewia banahaensis is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
